node.display_long_description:
Your body is frail, but your power is immense. Discover and master 11 individually designed spells with distinct abilities and effects. Forget about button combinations, command the arcane forces with nothing but hand gestures - as a true Wizard does!

A mysterious dark plague has fallen on the realm of Meliora, twisting its inhabitants into beings of hatred and madness. Forbidden powers and rogue wizards are involved, leaving only you to face the apocalypse head-on. Dare to journey through the Forsaken Wood, wade through the poisonous swamps of Meliora, descend into the ruinous Necropolis, and more - with no magical barriers to stop you in place!

Many fantastic creatures have fallen to the plague, becoming beings of destruction and death. Face new challenging enemies with unique abilities and individual behavior. Expect severe resistance - the world is ending, and it wants you dead too!

nodes.title: Patch 1.1 Now Live!
nodes.body_text:
Hello Wizards!

Welcome to the very first post here on the Oculus platform! We would like to thank everyone for playing our game, we hope you are having tons of spellcasting fun in the world of Meliora. A special thank you to those who also took the time to leave a review - your opinion always matters and we can't thank you enough!

Today, we're coming in hot with a brand new patch for the Dark Times, so check out what's new and improved:

FIXES:
- fixed some collision problems
- fixed some navigation issues
- better lightmaps
- improved precomputed visibility, i.e. flashing geometry in front of the player
- fixed several places where you could see through the wall behind the map
- fixed several places where you could fly off the map into an endless loop (quite scary)
- fixed white boxes behind the ashen forest, behind the gate
- fixed some issues with player height in standing/sitting mode
- fixed troll animations (he no longer glides, he now walks like a REAL troll)

NEW UPDATE:
- improved fireball and ice bow particles (quest 2 only)
- darkling skeleton (they should no longer stretch out after death)
- various visual fixes
- improved lightning indicators from lightning acolytes
- some enemy AI fixes
- improved CPU optimization
- cybershoes support implementation

We're also planning some exciting new things in the upcoming weeks, so stay tuned!

Until next time Wizards!

node.reviewDescription:
Let me get right to it. I have fun in the fights, and I have fun with the gesture based spells. The enemies in this, opposed to the last one, are great. Unique and a lot of fun. 
What doesn’t work. Resolution is pretty bad, just like in the first one. Which is pretty disappointing cause I’m playing on the Quest 2. 
How you interact with the environment is terrible and does not help immersion. Very glitchy, rendering environments while I’m walking through them. 
Level design is boring, just like in the first game, the devs have no love (more likely budget) for exploration. There’s many path-looking things that look like they might lead to a different section of the map but are always deadends. There’s nothing to explore, so you just press on. Also on that note, the narrator, who talks way too often, only gives you like 10 seconds to figure out what to do before he tells you, leaving nothing to figure out or explore.
Somethings don’t have sound bites wen they should. Like the stairs that roll out before you, really cool, but they make zero noise, just another thing that breaks immersion. 
Don’t know how long it is but the last one was pretty short, expecting the same thing

Man if people could comment on my review I would be getting RAILED by everyone. Lol but the truth is, VR players hate to write bad comments about games and I don’t know why that is. Yes, we are still at the beginning of VR and things aren’t going to be perfect. But telling the devs the things that don’t work is the only way things improve. 
This game is fun, maybe worth the 25, not sure though. It lacks in a lot of areas
node.reviewTitle: It’s fun, but not a great game

developerResponse.body:
CormactheKid, thank you very much for your feedback! We just released Patch 1.1 which addresses some of the issues you're talking about. 
We read all the reviews posted here, and we hope our continued support of Dark Times will improve your gameplay impressions!

You can always give us your feedback by e-mail at support@carbonstudio.pl or join our Discord at discord.gg/becomeawizard. Your satisfaction is very important to us.
